"Jealousy can be a powerful emotion, but it's important to remember that everyone has their own unique journey and pace. It's okay to feel a sense of accomplishment when someone else finishes a task seamlessly, but it's important to focus on your own progress and not compare yourself to others."

"One way to overcome jealousy is to practice gratitude. Instead of focusing on what others have accomplished, try to appreciate the things you have in your own life. This can help shift your perspective and reduce feelings of jealousy."

"Another way to deal with jealousy is to set realistic goals for yourself. When you have a clear understanding of what you want to achieve, you can focus on your own progress and not get caught up in comparing yourself to others."

"It can also be helpful to practice self-compassion. Instead of beating yourself up for not finishing a task seamlessly, try to treat yourself with kindness and understanding. Remember that everyone makes mistakes and it's okay to take things at your own pace."

"Finally, it's important to remember that success is not always about finishing a task seamlessly. It's about learning from the experience and using it to grow and improve. So, instead of focusing on how others finished their tasks, focus on what you can learn from their success and apply it to your own journey."
